subtitle:
1
00:00:08,000 --> 00:00:12,000
That super fast bundle of feathers was Patricia,
Hit-tui cháu-kah chin-kín ê ú-mô-kiû sī Patricia,

2
00:00:12,000 --> 00:00:16,000
a Pekin Bantam chicken.
chi̍t-chiah Pak-kiaⁿ é-kha-ke.

3
00:00:17,000 --> 00:00:19,000
And she's a hen with a mission.
I sī chi̍t-chiah tài jīm-bū ê ke-bó.

4
00:00:20,000 --> 00:00:26,000
Patricia is totally focused on looking after her clutch of eight eggs.
Patricia choân-sim-choân-ì teh kò͘ i hit peh lia̍p nn̄g.

5
00:00:29,000 --> 00:00:32,000
She's been sitting on them for almost three weeks.
I í-keng pū-nn̄g beh saⁿ lé-pài ah.

6
00:00:34,000 --> 00:00:38,000
She's lost weight; food is not the priority.
I siau-sán-lo̍h-bah; chia̍h-pn̄g m̄-sī siōng iàu-kín ê.

7
00:00:40,000 --> 00:00:45,000
She needs to ensure that her eggs are kept above 35 degrees and below 40.
I ài khak-sìn ke-nn̄g pó-chhî tī saⁿ-cha̍p-gō͘ tō͘ í-siōng, sì-cha̍p tō͘ í-hā.

8
00:00:47,000 --> 00:00:49,000
The first chicks are due to hatch,
Tē-it-phoe ke-á-kiáⁿ beh phòa-khak ah,

9
00:00:50,000 --> 00:00:52,000
so she's speaking to them.
só͘-í i tng-teh kap in kóng-ōe.

10
00:00:55,000 --> 00:01:00,000
Astonishingly, at this stage, unborn chicks are going through sleeping and waking cycles.
Ē hō͘ lâng kiaⁿ-chi̍t-tiô ê, sī tī chit-ê kai-toāⁿ, iáu-bē chhut-sì ê ke-á-kiáⁿ í-keng ū khùn kap chhéⁿ ê sûn-khoân.

11
00:01:03,000 --> 00:01:06,000
And when they hear mum's clucks, they wake up.
Thiaⁿ-tio̍h má-mah ê kiò-siaⁿ, in tio̍h ē chhéⁿ--kòe-lâi.

12
00:01:09,000 --> 00:01:11,000
No other noise has the same effect.
Kî-tha ê siaⁿ-im lóng bô kāng-khoán ê hāu-kó.

13
00:01:13,000 --> 00:01:15,000
Moments before hatch-off,
Beh phòa-khak chìn-chêng bô-gōa-kú,

14
00:01:16,000 --> 00:01:18,000
it becomes a two-way conversation.
che piàn-sêng siang-hong-bīn ê tùi-ōe.

15
00:01:19,000 --> 00:01:21,000
The chick begins to chirp,
Ke-á-kiáⁿ khai-sí chhi-chhí-chhu̍h-chhu̍h,

16
00:01:23,000 --> 00:01:26,000
heralding its imminent arrival.
Ī-kò i sûi-sî beh chhut--lâi ah.

17
00:01:34,000 --> 00:01:39,000
When the first cracks appear, the chick's chirps increase in volume.
Tng thâu-chi̍t-ê pit-sûn chhut-hiān, ke-bó ê kiò-siaⁿ lú-lâi lú tōa-siaⁿ.

18
00:01:51,000 --> 00:01:54,000
And while mum cheerleads,
Tng má-mah teh thè i ka-iû ê sî,

19
00:01:58,000 --> 00:02:04,000
the chick uses a special egg tooth on the end of its beak to pierce the shell and unzip.
ke-á-kiáⁿ iōng chhùi-bóe téng-koân te̍k-pia̍t ê "nn̄g-khí", kā nn̄g-khak tok-phòa koh thí--khui.

20
00:02:29,000 --> 00:02:32,000
Once out, the chick continues to chirp,
Chi̍t chhut--lâi liáu-āu, ke-á-kiáⁿ kè-sio̍k chhi-chhí-chhu̍h-chhu̍h,

21
00:02:34,000 --> 00:02:39,000
communicating with the remaining unborn chicks to encourage them to break free.
kap kî-tha iáu-bē chhut-sì ê ke-á-kiáⁿ ko-thong, kó͘-lē in kóaⁿ-kín chhut--lâi.

22
00:02:47,000 --> 00:02:51,000
But all that egg breaking and chirping take their toll.
M̄-koh, beh tok-phòa nn̄g-khak koh ti̍t-ti̍t-kiò, si̍t-chāi ài chin chhut-la̍t.

23
00:02:59,000 --> 00:03:04,000
Once Patricia's clutch has hatched, her focus shifts to keeping an eye on her babies while they play.
Tán Patricia kui-siū ê ke-á-kiáⁿ lóng pū--chhut-lâi, i ê chù-ì-le̍k tiō choán-khì kò͘ in teh chhit-thô.

24
00:03:11,000 --> 00:03:15,000
And with special clucks she tells them where to look for food.
Koh iōng te̍k-pia̍t ê kiò-siaⁿ kā in kóng tó-ūi chhōe ē-tio̍h si̍t-bu̍t.

25
00:03:20,000 --> 00:03:23,000
If they feel tired or cold, mum's there to provide shelter.
Nā-sī in kám-kak thiám ia̍h-sī koâⁿ, má-mah tiō ē kā in pó-hō͘.

26
00:03:27,000 --> 00:03:30,000
In fact, she's always there to protect her chicks.
Kî-si̍t, i sûi-sî lóng tī hia teh pó-hō͘ i ê ke-á-kiáⁿ.

vocab.def: To cheer on / Keep it up
